Data.TextElement: Reporting for Canadian energy infrastructure continues this week with 7 companies reporting (BEP and VSN today), followed by 11 companies next week. Exhibit 1 lists chronological reporting dates for the names under coverage, including our Q1/17E estimates. The table also reflects changes in consensus estimates since our Q1/17 earnings preview published on April 20. Notable changes in consensus expectations include: 1) H (EPS to $0.31 from $0.33, or -6%); 2) IPL (EBITDA to $295M from $286M or +3%); and 3) ENB (EPS to $0.65 from $0.67 or -3%).

Approximately 20% of our Canadian energy Infrastructure companies have reported so far. Reporting for Canadian energy infrastructure continues this week with seven companies reporting, followed by eleven companies next week to close off the season. Five have reported so far (three beats and two misses relative to consensus).

Earnings calendar table. Exhibit 1 lists chronological reporting dates for the names under coverage, including our Q1/17E estimates. The table also reflects changes in consensus estimates since our Q1/17 earnings preview comment published on April 20. Notable changes include: 1) H (EPS to $0.31 from $0.33, or -6%); 2) IPL (EBITDA to $295M from $286M or +3%); and 3) ENB (EPS to $0.65 from $0.67 or -3%).

Recommendations. We are maintaining our Outperform ratings on BLX, FTS, AQN, CPX, BEP, INE, and PEGI within utility and power, and ENB, TRP, and PPL within pipeline and midstream.

What we've learned so far. 1) The strong frac spread environment (average US$0.35/gallon in Q1/17 vs. US$0.19 in Q1/16) is benefiting midstream results as evident in the ALA gas midstream results ($67M segment EBITDA vs. our $53M). Marketing is also boosting results. We believe GEI, IPL, PPL, and VSN could directionally benefit from this positive dynamic. 2) Production results so far on wind farms we follow highlighted improved resource conditions, particularly relative to the softness we observed last year. Also, NextEra reported Q1/17 wind production that was 101% of the long-term average. PEGI is the most levered to wind in our coverage. 3) Acquisitions are continuing at a torrid pace. On Monday, PPL/VSN announced a $33B combination, and on April 28, ENB acquired the balance of the Midcoast gas assets from Enbridge Energy Partners (EEP-NYSE, not rated). EEP also noted the potential for future liquid drop-downs from Enbridge Inc. given its improved balance sheet metrics and dividend coverage.

What we remain focused on. 1) Dividend increase announcements from ENB (+6% to bring 2017 annual growth to +15%) and PEGI (+2%). 2) Alberta gas processing and NGL volumes (positive datapoints from ALA's Q1/17 results). 3) Updated commentary from the North American utilities regarding U.S. President Trump's recent proposed tax plan. 4) The status of acquisition integration/synergies following last year's record year for Canadian energy infrastructure acquisitions. 5) A potential return to normal hydrology conditions following a very weak 2016. 6) Any significant change in the Alberta power forward curve following Sundance A retirement/mothball.

Reporting for Canadian energy infrastructure continues this week with 7 companies reporting (BEP and VSN today), followed by 11 companies next week. Exhibit 1 lists chronological reporting dates for the names under coverage, including our Q1/17E estimates. The table also reflects changes in consensus estimates since our Q1/17 earnings preview published on April 20. Notable changes in consensus expectations include: 1) H (EPS to $0.31 from $0.33, or -6%); 2) IPL (EBITDA to $295M from $286M or +3%); and 3) ENB (EPS to $0.65 from $0.67 or -3%).
Data.BoilerPlate: We believe the shares are attractively valued at current levels. Our rating is Outperform.
We believe the shares are attractively valued at current levels. Our rating is Outperform.
We believe the shares are attractively valued at current levels. Our rating is Outperform.
We believe the shares are reasonably valued at current levels. Our rating is Market Perform.
Our target price is based on the average of applying an EV/EBITDA multiple of 15.5x to our FY18E estimates and a DCF.

FTS trades at 16.5x forward P/E, in line with peer group utility average of 16.5x. We believe a modest premium is warranted given FTS's above-average dividend growth profile and low business risk (100% regulated/contracted exposure). Our $51 price target is based on a blend of our DCF and a forward P/E multiple of 19x applied to our 2018 estimate.

INE trades at 2018E FCF Yield of ~7.5% compared to the peer contracted power average of 7.5%. A premium multiple is warranted given INE's premium long-life hydro assets underpinned by high-quality counterparties and strong execution track record. Our target price is based on the average of applying an EV/EBITDA multiple of 14.5x to our FY18 estimates and a DCF.
Our $18.65 target price represents the PPL offer at day of announcement.
Our upside scenario of $85 assumes that the shares trade at an implied forward FCF yield of 5.5% on enhancement to the 10-12% dividend growth profile (i.e., material new projects/acquisitions).

Our upside scenario of $54.50 assumes that bond yields remain at historical lows levels and the dividend growth guidance is revised higher from the current 6%. This scenario price is based on a 21x forward P/E multiple.

Our upside scenario of $21.50 assumes that bond yields remain at historical lows levels and that additional development opportunities are crystallized (i.e., Canada, Mexico, France). This scenario price is based on 15.5x forward EV/EBITDA.
Our upside scenario of $18.65 reflects the offer price proposed by PPL. Given the attractive offer proposed by PPL, we would not anticipate any additional buyers stepping in for VSN at this point.

Our downside scenario of $47 assumes that the shares trade at an implied forward FCF yield of 10%, which would be a function of balance sheet concerns and reduced growth prospects (project delays, cost overruns, equity needs).
Our downside scenario case of $39 assumes bond yields rise significantly and management isn't able to deliver to growth guidance. This scenario price implies a 15x forward P/E multiple.
Our downside scenario case of $12.50 assumes bond yields rise significantly and that growth normalizes to inflation. This scenario price implies 12.5x forward EV/EBITDA.
Our downside scenario of $14 reflects our previous target price, prior to the proposed offer by PPL, which is based on the average of applying an EV/EBITDA of 11.5x to our FY2018 estimates and a DCF.

Enbridge's business platforms include an extensive network of crude oil, liquids and natural gas pipelines, gas distribution utilities, and renewable power generation. Enbridge delivers an average of 2.8 mbbls/d of crude oil each, accounting for ~68% of U.S.-bound Canadian crude oil production, and moves approximately 20% of all natural gas consumed in the U.S.

Fortis Inc. is a publicly listed holding company with three key businesses: electric utility operations, regulated natural gas distribution, and non-regulated electric power generation. Its assets of more than $48B serve customers in five Canadian provinces, nine U.S. states and three Caribbean countries.

Innergex Renewable Energy Inc. is an independent power producer that owns a portfolio of projects that consists of: 1) interests in 47 operating facilities with an aggregate net installed capacity of 939MW, 2) interests in two projects under construction with an aggregate net installed capacity of 71MW, and 3) prospective projects totaling ~3,560MW (net).
Veresen (VSN) owns various ownership interests in several energy infrastructure assets in the U.S. and Canada, including pipelines, midstream and contracted power generation.
Our target price is based on the average of applying an EV/EBITDA multiple of 15.5x to our FY18E estimates and a DCF.
Our target price is based on the average of applying a P/E multiple of 19.0x to our FY18E estimates and a DCF.
Our target price is based on the average of applying an EV/EBITDA multiple of 14.5x to our FY18E estimates and a DCF.
Our $18.65 target price is based on PPL's proposed offer for VSN at day of announcement.
1) volume risk on Mainline, 2) regulatory risk, 3) U.S.-Canadian exchange rates, and 4) project execution risk.
Key risks include interest rates, execution, acquisition integration, capital markets, and regulatory risk.
Key risks include interest rates, execution, capital markets, foreign exchange, and weather risk.
1) volume risk, 2) commodity prices, 3) dividend reduction, and 4) U.S.-Canadian exchanges rates

Legal.Disclaimer:
* Reflects rating distribution of all companies covered by BMO Capital Markets Corp. equity research analysts.
** Reflects rating distribution of all companies from which BMO Capital Markets Corp. has received compensation for Investment Banking services as percentage within ratings category.
*** Reflects rating distribution of all companies from which BMO Capital Markets Corp. has received compensation for Investment Banking services as percentage of Investment Banking clients.
**** Reflects rating distribution of all companies covered by BMO Capital Markets equity research analysts.
***** Reflects rating distribution of all companies from which BMO Capital Markets has received compensation for Investment Banking services as percentage of Investment Banking clients.

Ratings Key (as of October 2016)

We use the following ratings system definitions:
OP = Outperform - Forecast to outperform the analyst’s coverage universe on a total return basis;
Mkt = Market Perform - Forecast to perform roughly in line with the analyst’s coverage universe on a total return basis;
Und = Underperform - Forecast to underperform the analyst’s coverage universe on a total return basis;
(S) = Speculative investment;
Spd = Suspended - Coverage and rating suspended until coverage is reinstated;
NR = No Rated - No rating at this time; and
R = Restricted - Dissemination of research is currently restricted.

BMO Capital Markets' seven Top 15 lists guide investors to our best ideas according to different objectives (CDN Large Cap, CDN Small Cap, US Large Cap, US Small Cap, Income, CDN Quant, and US Quant have replaced the Top Pick rating).

Dissemination of Research

Dissemination of BMO Capital Markets Equity Research is available via our website https://research-ca.bmocapitalmarkets.com/Public/Secure/Login.aspx? ReturnUrl=/Member/Home/ResearchHome.aspx. Institutional clients may also receive our research via Thomson Reuters, Bloomberg, FactSet, and Capital IQ. Research reports and other commentary are required to be simultaneously disseminated internally and externally to our clients.

~ Research distribution and approval times are provided on the cover of each report. Times are approximations as system and distribution processes are not exact and can vary based on the sender and recipients’ services. Unless otherwise noted, times are Eastern Standard and when two times are provided, the approval time precedes the distribution time.

BMO Capital Markets may use proprietary models in the preparation of reports. Material information about such models may be obtained by contacting the research analyst directly. There is no planned frequency of updates to this report.

Additional Matters

To Canadian Residents: BMO Nesbitt Burns Inc. furnishes this report to Canadian residents and accepts responsibility for the contents herein subject to the terms set out above. Any Canadian person wishing to effect transactions in any of the securities included in this report should do so through BMO Nesbitt Burns Inc.

The following applies if this research was prepared in whole or in part by Alexander Pearce, David Round, Edward Sterck or Brendan Warn: This research is not prepared subject to Canadian disclosure requirements. This research is prepared by BMO Capital Markets Limited and subject to the regulations of the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) in the United Kingdom. FCA regulations require that a firm providing research disclose its ownership interest in the issuer that is the subject of the research if it and its affiliates own 5% or more of the equity of the issuer. Canadian regulations require that a firm providing research disclose its ownership interest in the issuer that is the subject of the research if it and its affiliates own 1% or more of the equity of the issuer that is the subject of the research. Therefore BMO Capital Markets Limited will disclose its and its affiliates' ownership interest in the subject issuer only if such ownership exceeds 5% of the equity of the issuer.
